intro: Eunanus bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's eunanus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and chaparral areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, and it is often found in coastal regions of California. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
